document.discussion_title: Nick Bonino brings Stanley Cup to Avon - WFSB 3 Connecticut
document.topic_text: Nick Bonino brings Stanley Cup to Avon Posted: Nick Bonino brings the Stanley Cup home to Avon Old Farms. (WFSB) AVON, CT (WFSB) - NHL hockey player Nick Bonino brought the Stanley Cup to Connecticut on Thursday. Bonino has been a champion at every level. He won a title at Farmington High School, a New England prep title at Avon Old Farms, a college championship at Boston University and now a Stanley Cup Championship with Pittsburgh Penguins. "I dreamed of it," Bonino said about the Stanley Cup Championship. Every member of the team gets one day with the cup and Bonino got his on Thursday. Bonino brought the Stanley Cup to Avon Old Farms, so the public could take pictures. The Cup has arrived! @NickBonino back at his alma mater @avonoldfarms . Huge number of fans await pictures. @WFSBnews pic.twitter.com/rCaSfr7C51 — John Holt (@JohnHoltWFSB) August 11, 2016 Pictures were free but fans were encouraged to make a donation to the Connecticut Children's Medical Center. A big, big crowd was at Bonino's alma mater, where they brought new meaning to the word "cupping." The cup came to @avonoldfarms and the LINE runneth over. Out. The. Door. And then some. #Bonino @WFSBnews pic.twitter.com/Sl5HSPZ9gA — John Holt (@JohnHoltWFSB) August 11, 2016 To see the photos of his visit on your mobile device, click here . Copyright 2016 WFSB (Meredith Corporation). All rights reserved. Most Popular Stories Most Popular Stories More>>
